intro: Michauxia thyrsoidea, commonly known as the yellow-flowered thyrsoide, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in alpine environments. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, while its flowers bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and somewhat endangered species in its native range.
